result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Jerrod Liggins

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Young notified the court that she is unable to appear due to the SPD conference. Case is adjourned in Branch 30, parties notified.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Edward Jerrod Liggins
Current: 8673 N 73rd St, Milwaukee, WI 53223 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2022)
Prior: 2620 North 7th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Edward Jerrod Liggins appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Edward Jerrod Liggins.  attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. AS TO COUNT 2: Motion to dismiss by defense for lack of probable cause, due to incorrect date of offense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
